title: How to Start a Permaculture Food Forest #NaturalFarming #Shorts

tasks.task: Planting fruit trees and surrounding gardens on one acre land
subtasks: Listen to initial advice on starting farming
Determine to use one acre land for fruit trees and gardens
Research fruit trees suitable for local climate and soil
Calculate number of fruit trees based on one acre land
Arrange fruit trees with two and a half meter diameter circles around each
Identify plant species for each circle (tapioca, maravillikelinga, kappa, drumstick, papaya, bananas, pumpkins)
Set up drip irrigation systems for each circle
Water and maintain fruit trees and surrounding gardens
Harvest fruits and vegetables from trees and gardens

tasks.task: Implementing water conservation through drip irrigation
subtasks: Understand the need for efficient water usage
Research and purchase drip irrigation systems
Install drip irrigation systems for each fruit tree circle
Monitor and maintain drip irrigation systems

tasks.task: Embracing pragmatic yet romantic approach to farming
subtasks: Appreciate the romantic idea behind the concept
Recognize the practicality and realism of the advice
Adapt traditional farming methods to modern practices
Balance idealism with practical considerations in agriculture
